New Records: India's lowest score against Pakistan in Men's T20 World Cups, bowled out for 119.
Key Match Events: India defeated Pakistan by 6 runs in a low-scoring thriller.
Jasprit Bumrah was named PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his spell of 3 for 14.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli were dismissed early.
Rishabh Pant played a crucial innings but got out at a critical time.
Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah were effective with the new ball.
Haris Rauf took key wickets in the middle overs.
India's bowlers, especially Bumrah, Siraj, and Pandya, defended a low total effectively.
Pakistan's batting collapsed under pressure, with key wickets falling at crucial moments.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam opted to bowl first given the weather and pitch conditions.
Rohit Sharma mentioned that they would have bowled first as well and emphasized the importance of assessing the pitch quickly.
Both teams fielded strong playing XIs with Pakistan making one change, bringing in Imad Wasim for Azam Khan.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma acknowledged that India fell 15-20 runs short but praised the bowlers for their performance.
Babar Azam reflected on Pakistan's batting failures and mentioned the need to improve in the next games.
Jasprit Bumrah expressed satisfaction with his performance and the crowd support.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was delayed due to rain but resumed without any overs lost.
The game was played in New York, adding a unique venue to the rivalry.
The pitch conditions were challenging, with the ball stopping in the surface.
